citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility representative was unable to access and produce a copy of the completed Program of Veterinary Care for
USDA review during the inspection. A copy of the Program of Veterinary Care is required to be available during inspection
so that USDA may verify that a documented program is in place. Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ and attending
veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the
formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care. To be corrected by 6-20-24.

The enclosure housing the great horned owl is not maintained in good repair, there are multiple areas where the panel
edges of the ceiling netting have separated, leaving gaps that can allow the owl access to the open space between the
netting and the roof above. The gaps create a possible entanglement and injury hazard to the owl. Primary enclosures for
birds must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound and must be kept in good
repair to contain the birds and protect them from injury.
To be corrected by 6-20-24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the collection curator and a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Shoshana Tanenbaum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
